question.body: One of the functions of the mixing waves is to break the food up into smaller pieces. Why does this assist with chemical digestion?

multiple_choice.choice: The chemical digestion is not affected by the size of the food particles.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Proteins are denatured by the chemical HCl. This acid unfolds proteins.
Correct. By breaking down the food into smaller pieces the enzymes of chemical digestion are able to more efficiently digest the food.
Incorrect. HCl is an acid that is already in its active form.
Incorrect. The larger the molecules the smaller the surface area to volume ratio and the less effective the digestive enzymes are.
